meanings.definition: A metallic element with the symbol Sn and atomic number 50.
meanings.sent1: I found a shiny piece of tin on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The tin roof of the house gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The little robot was made entirely of tin and clanked around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed off the walls like tin in an empty room.
meanings.sent5: The tin can rattled as it rolled down the hill.

meanings.definition: A container or can made of tinplate.
meanings.sent1: Mom packed my lunch in a tin for the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The old tin held a collection of colorful marbles.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel got its head stuck in the tin and ran around in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang out like opening a tin of cookies.
meanings.sent5: The tin box was filled with memories of their adventures.

meanings.definition: To coat or plate with tin.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman will tin the copper pot to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to tin the jewelry to give it a shiny finish.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally tinned the cake with salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to tin the room with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully tinned the edges of the painting for a polished look.
